page.title: 01Tourism Stirling
page.content: A castle standing on a rock is the first impression of Stirling as you approach it. Then gradually you begin to see the Old Town further down the rock. There are lots of old buildings in this part of the town, which we know as the Top of the Town. The Old Prison, Mars Wark and the Holy Rude Church, where James VI was crowned as a baby, are a few of the buildings. Stirling began as a crossing place over the river. It wasn't so marshy there so it was easier to cross. Nowadays there are three bridges, one for pedestrians, one for vehicles and one for trains. People sometimes call Stirling the "Gateway to the Highlands". The River Forth winds through the flat, open land which surrounds the rock on which Stirling is built. Now the marshy land has dried up and is used for farming.
